subject: Philosophy
title: Memento Mori
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Memento Mori.

hook.text: Roman generals rode through cheering crowds while a slave whispered: 'Remember, you will die.'

twist.text: Seneca said it's not that life is short. It's that we waste so much of it on things that don't matter.

climax.text: Death awareness doesn't create anxiety. Done right, it creates urgency and clarity.
